place_of_publication.publication_title: in C. Hartman, Handb. Skand. Fl. ed.

bio:treatment.discussion: Seligeria acutifolia is known from only a few localities along the hyperoceanic West Coast. It differs from similar species in having sharply differentiated perichaetial leaves and a short, stout seta. The capsules are usually shortly exserted or sometimes emergent.
